text: sponsored by the deck of many calm when
some of my players tracked a dragon down
to its lair the ground rumbled and
writhed then something strange happened
the dragon left from a lake and stood
totally exposed had looked down at the
players haltingly and spoke have you
come to look upon the majesty of coward
rocks boo boo and as it spoke its words
didn't seem to match its movements as
the conversation evolved ruin our
fighter still rattled from a devastating
trap was alert he felt the ground move
again and he looked down then whispered
- tanzy our druid she cast entangle on
the ground just in time the dragon was
an illusion Calla trucks was burrowing
underneath them nor on one what tansy
did probably save the team but in the
short-term after wasting a turn trying
to thrash its way out the dragon a magic
user herself spotted tansy and started
the fight with a brutal breath against
tansy and ruin took 66 damage when your
characters hit points to reduce below
zero or less they drop into an unstable
unconscious fate massive damage can also
kill your character outright if an
attack reduces you to zero hit points
and there's still damage remaining you
have to check that damage against your
maximum HP if it's more you die
instantly ruin had already taken a lot
of damage and so he only had 15 HP when
they attack hit he was instantly killed
okay let's say you're like tansy and it
wasn't enough to kill you outright great
that means you have zero HP and are
basically unconscious and actively ty
now it's time on your turns to start
making death saves to make a death save
you roll a d20 with no modifiers against
a DC of ten you must make three death
saves to stabilize and be treated as
living but unconscious and the only
thing that can wake you up is gaining HP
above zero through either healing or
resting to die you have to fail three
death saves before you stabilize also
crypt fails or crit successes count as
two saves or two fails respectively
finally if one of your friends doesn't
want you to die and they have healing
magic they can heal you which will
instantly bring you back up or if they
don't have healing magic they can make a
dc-10 Medicine check basic
seed they stabilize you but you're still
unconscious so say your friends think
that they have something more important
to do this is where D&D gets nasty any
successful attack against an unconscious
character counts as a single death save
failure but all attacks made against
unconscious creatures have advantage and
if the attacker is within 5 feet the hit
counts as a crit critical hits that
don't kill an unconscious character
outright counting as to death save
failures so god help you if you're left
unattended in a world with magical
healing most creatures that aren't
actively engaged with other enemies
would as Matt Koval says step on your
head
to make sure you're dead by the way
tanzie did make her saves but when she
awoke only one other party member
remained thanks for watching this
episode of the animated spellbook
